election_record.label: New York 1811 State Senate, Eastern District

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 3 votes as Zebulon Shipherd, 1 vote as Zebulon B. Shipherd and 1 vote as Zebulon R. Shiperherd.
Ruggles Hubbard received 1 vote as Ruggs Hubbard.
Stephen Van Rensselaer received 1 vote as Stephen Van Renssela.
William Bailey received 1 vote as William Biley.
The vote for Highcrieger was not listed in the Official Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Two
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 1 vote as Zebulon B. Shipherd.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: Stephen Van Rensselaer received 1 vote as Stephen Van Renssela.
Zebulon R. Shipherd received 2 votes as Zebulon Shipherd.

sub_unit.name: Coeymans
sub_unit.note: Ruggles Hubbard received 1 vote as Ruggs Hubbard.
William Bailey received 1 vote as William Biley.
Zebulon R. Shipherd received 1 vote as Zebulon Shipherd.

sub_unit.name: Guilderland
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists Elisha Arnold with 80 votes.

sub_unit.name: Watervliet
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 1 vote as Zebulon R. Shiperherd.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: John Tayler received 18 votes as John John Tayler.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 2 votes as Zebulon Shipherd.
John Tayler received 2 votes as John Taylor.
Elisha Arnold received 1 vote as Elish Arnold.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 2 votes as Zebulon Shipherd.
The Montgomery Monitor (Johnstown, NY) lists Elisha Arnold with 1751 votes and David Allen with 1510 votes though the town totals add up to 1749 and 1511.
The Columbian (New York, NY) lists Zebulon R. Shipherd with 1524 votes and David Allen with 1509 votes though the town totals add up to 1514 and 1511.

sub_unit.name: Broadalban
sub_unit.note: The Montgomery Monitor (Johnstown, NY), lists Elisha Arnold with 142 votes.

sub_unit.name: Charleston
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 16 lists Elisha Arnold with 204 votes.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: Kitchel Bishop received 1 vote as Richard Bisho
Zebulon R. Shipherd received 2 votes as Zebulon Shipherd.

"The Senatorial Tickets stand about the same as the above [results for Lieutenant Governor]; except that Mr. Hubbard (alias Pilgarlic) is 126 votes in the rear of his colleagues on the demo. ticket, and 513 below Mr. Van Rensselaer, one of the federal candidates" Lansingburgh Gazette (Lansingburgh, NY). May 7, 1811.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of May 7, lists Zebulon Shipherd with 118 votes.

sub_unit.name: Greenbush
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of May 7, lists Zebulon Shipherd with 186 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hoosick
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of May 7 and Lansingburgh Gazette (Lansingburgh, NY) of May 14, list Elisha Arnold with 140 votes.

sub_unit.name: Petersburgh
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget (Troy, NY) of May 7, lists Zebulon Shipherd with 63 votes.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: Kitchel Bishop received 1 vote as Jichel Bisho
Zebulon R. Shipherd received 6 votes as Zebulon Shipherd.
John Tayler received 2 votes as John W. Taylor.

sub_unit.name: Galway
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 23 lists Zebulon Shipherd with 10 votes, but the total votes it lists for the county matches the total votes listed in other sources.

sub_unit.name: Schenectady
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 4 votes as Zebulon Shipherd
Elisha Arnold received 1 vote as Elisha Anold.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: Zebulon R. Shipherd received 2 votes as Zeublon Shipherd.
Ruggles Hubbard received 1 vote as Ruggles Hubbound.
Stephen Van Rensselaer received 1 vote as Stephen Van Rasler.
John Tayler received 1 vote as John Taylor.

sub_unit.name: Easton
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 27, lists Ruggles Hubbard with 84 votes.

election_record.reference: The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY). May 14, 1811.
The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). June 12, 1811.
The New York Journal (New York, NY). June 12, 1811.
